DOC.brief_summary: The specific objective research proposal determine short-term efficacy primary care-based weight control intervention successful volunteer peer deliver group-based program . The purpose study conduct pilot randomize control trial ( RCT ) successful volunteer peer-led weight control program compare control condition determine intervention efficacy 3 month . Six peer leader 2 primary care clinic recruit trained conduct intervention . Overweight obese patient ( n=80 ) recruit ( randomize individual ) determine weight loss 3 month ( primary outcome ) . The program consist 12 weekly weight loss session lead successful volunteer peer leader use adaptation Diabetes Prevention Program help participant lose weight .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Volunteer Peer-Led Intervention Weight Control Primary Care
DOC.detailed_description: The intervention consist 12 weekly one-hour weight loss session lead successful volunteer peer . The initial weight loss session conduct peer leader oversight PI . This session serve introduce program give overview program . The remain session , conduct co-peer leader , utilize adaptation Diabetes Prevention Program . This adaptation allow use group set facilitation lay individual . Control Condition : Participants control condition give write information baseline visit NIH website `` Aim Healthy Weight '' provide basic understand weight loss access basic online resource . We expect use website may result weight loss . However , similar information-only intervention small effect , account sample size calculation .
DOC.criteria: PEER Successful volitional weight loss , define least 10 % initial body weight maintenance â‰¥ 1 year Fluently speak read English Willing volunteer 1 hour week group leader Able willing give inform consent . Must internet access Participant Fluently speak read English Able willing give inform consent Body Mass Index > 25 < 45 Interested participate weekly group session weight loss Must internet access Current plan pregnancy within next year Medical contraindication weight loss , include , limited , history : 1 . Myocardial infarction 2 . Stroke 3 . Unstable angina 4 . Congestive heart failure 5 . Cancer ( except nonmelanoma skin cancer ) History gastric bypass surgery schedule surgery purpose Current use prescription medication weight loss Weight loss > 5 % current body weight previous 6 month Contraindications weight loss Evidence severe cognitive impairment major psychiatric illness Plans move next 6 month Answering yes question Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ )
